title: Mallow Shot
detail: Advanced computer vision turret with marshmallows.
extended_details:
A person stands in front of the robot. We run live face detection to determine when they open their mouth. Once their mouth is open, we pull depth data from a Kinect to determine it's exact position.

Two high-torque servos pan and tilt the marshmallow launcher in order to follow a perfectly parabolic path into the open mouth. A continuous stream of marshmallows is launched until the person closes their mouth or moves their head away.

The marshmallow launcher uses a spring-solenoid mechanism, or a regulated low-pressure compressed air source for power. Consecutive marshmallows are loaded from a vertical tube with a custom feeder mechanism to avoid jams.
